sections.title: What is C++?
sections.content: C++ is a powerful, high-performance programming language that supports both procedural and object-oriented programming paradigms. It was developed as an extension of the C language to include features like classes and objects.

list.title: Performance
list.content: C++ allows fine-grained control over system resources, making it ideal for game development, systems programming, and applications requiring high performance.

list.title: Object-Oriented Programming
list.content: Supports classes and objects, helping to build modular and reusable code.

list.title: Widely Used
list.content: Used in software like browsers, operating systems, and large-scale applications.

sections.title: Creating Your First Program
steps: Create a new file or project.

sections.title: Variable Declaration
sections.content: Variables must be declared with a type before use.

sections.title: Input Taking in C++
sections.content: Use cin to take input from the user.

sections.title: C++ Syntax: Loops
sections.content: C++ supports for, while, and do-while loops to repeat blocks of code.

sections.title: C++ Syntax: Conditional Statements
sections.content: Control program flow using if, else if, and else statements.

sections.title: C++ Syntax: Methods (Functions)
sections.content: Functions help organize reusable blocks of code.

title: Getting Started: Coding on Java Compilers Online

sections.title: What is Java?
sections.content: Java is a high-level, class-based, and object-oriented programming language. With its 'Write Once, Run Anywhere' (WORA) capability, Java code can run on any system equipped with the Java Virtual Machine (JVM), offering platform independence. It's widely used for web, mobile, and enterprise applications.

list.title: Versatility
list.content: Java is used across Android development, desktop applications, web apps using Servlets/JSPs, and enterprise software.

list.title: Community and Support
list.content: Java has a huge global developer community, offering support via forums, tutorials, and libraries.

list.title: Job Opportunities
list.content: Java developers are consistently in demand in tech companies of all sizes, ensuring job security and growth.

sections.title: Variable Declaration and Data Types
sections.content: Variables are containers for storing data values. Java is statically typed, so you must declare a variable's type before using it.

sections.title: Taking User Input
sections.content: Java uses the Scanner class from the java.util package to read input from the user.

sections.title: Java Syntax: Loops
sections.content: Loops help execute a block of code repeatedly. Java supports for, while, and do-while loops.

sections.title: Java Syntax: Conditional Statements
sections.content: Conditional logic allows your program to make decisions using if, else if, and else.

sections.title: Java Syntax: Methods
sections.content: In Java, functions are known as methods and must be written inside a class. They are used to perform specific tasks.

sections.title: What is C?
sections.content: C is a procedural, high-level programming language developed in the early 1970s by Dennis Ritchie. It's widely used for system programming and embedded devices.

list.title: Foundation Language
list.content: Many modern languages are influenced by C.

list.title: Performance
list.content: Efficient and fast programs for system-level tasks.

Variable Declaration

sections.title: Input Taking in C
sections.content: Use scanf to take user input.

sections.title: C Syntax: Loops
sections.content: Use for, while, and do-while loops to execute repeated tasks.

sections.title: C Syntax: Conditional Statements

title: Getting Started: Coding on Python Compilers Online

sections.title: What is Python?
sections.content: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language known for its readability and ease of use. It supports multiple programming paradigms, including procedural, object-oriented, and functional programming.

list.title: Versatility
list.content: Used in web development, data science, AI, automation, and more.

sections.title: Creating Your First Program
sections.code: print("Hello, world!")

sections.title: Variable Declaration
sections.content: Variables are created when first assigned; no explicit declaration needed.
sections.code:
age = 25
name = "Alice"
price = 19.99

sections.title: Input Taking in Python
sections.content: Use input() to get user input as a string. In Judge0 or other non-interactive environments, prefer sys.stdin.readline() to simulate stdin input.
sections.code:
import sys
name = sys.stdin.readline().strip()
print(f"Hello, {name}")

sections.title: Python Syntax: Loops
sections.content: Python supports for and while loops.

sections.title: Python Syntax: Conditional Statements
sections.content: Use if, elif, and else to control flow.

sections.title: Python Syntax: Methods (Functions)
sections.content: Functions are defined using def keyword.
sections.code:
def add(a, b):
    return a + b

title: Getting Started: Coding on JavaScript Compilers Online

sections.title: What is JavaScript?
sections.content: JavaScript is a versatile, high-level programming language primarily used to create interactive effects within web browsers.

list.title: Web Development
list.content: JavaScript is essential for front-end and increasingly back-end web development.

list.title: Versatility
list.content: Can be used for web, mobile apps, server-side scripting, and more.

list.title: Large Ecosystem
list.content: Thousands of libraries and frameworks available.

sections.title: Creating Your First Program
sections.code: console.log("Hello, world!");

sections.title: Variable Declaration
sections.content: Variables can be declared using var, let, or const.

sections.title: Input Taking in JavaScript
sections.content: Use prompt() to get input from the user (browser environment). In environments like Judge0 or Node.js where prompt() is not available, use fs.readFileSync to take input from stdin.

sections.title: JavaScript Syntax: Loops
sections.content: JavaScript supports for, while, and do-while loops.

sections.title: JavaScript Syntax: Conditional Statements
sections.content: Use if, else if, and else to control program flow.

sections.title: JavaScript Syntax: Methods (Functions)
sections.content: Functions are reusable blocks of code defined with the function keyword. They help break down tasks.
